editors.name: Jing Meng

editors.affiliation: University College London, London, United Kingdom
editors.name: Zhifu Mi
editors.biography: Dr. Zhifu Mi is a Professor of Climate Change Economics at University College London. He has published papers in leading journals, such as Lancet, Science Advances, Nature Energy, Nature Geoscience, Nature Sustainability, and Nature Food. He was named in the Clarivate Highly Cited Researchers list and Forbes 30 Under 30 Europe list. He was awarded the 2018 World Sustainability Award for his leading research in the methodological developments and applications of carbon footprint. His research was awarded the 2021 Best Paper Award in Energy Economics and 2017 Best Early Career Article in Environmental Research Letters.

editors.affiliation: University of Santiago de Compostela, Department of Chemical Engineering, Santiago De Compostela, Spain
editors.name: Maria Teresa Moreira
editors.biography: Full Professor at the University of Santiago de Compostela since 2011 with research topics related to Biochemical, Chemical and Environmental Engineering. Scientific Director of the Centre for Research in Environmental Technologies CRETUS of the USC since 2020. Associate Editor (since 2017) and Executive Editor (since 2019) of the Journal of Cleaner Production. Among the 2% of the most cited scientists in the world, according to the report developed by Stanford University.\nI have published more than 370 manuscripts indexed in the SCI (75% Q1, 33.7% D1) with an H factor of 66. I have supervised 24 doctoral theses and developed 7 patents. Principal investigator of about 40 national and European projects. Research Award in the area of Technical Sciences by the Royal Galician Academy of Sciences.\nI have carried out several research stays at the Wageningen Agricultural University in the Netherlands, at the School of Biochemical Engineering of the Catholic University of Valparaíso in Chile, at the EULA Centre of the University of Concepción in Chile and at the Dept. of Chemical and Environmental Engineering, University of Arizona (USA).

editors.affiliation: NOVA University of Lisbon, Faculty of Science and Technology, Caparica, Portugal
editors.name: Tomás Ramos
editors.biography: Professor of Sustainability Assessment and Planning at NOVA University Lisbon, NOVA School of Science and Technology, Department of Environmental Sciences and Engineering, and senior researcher at CENSE, Center for Environmental and Sustainability Research. He has been visiting professor/researcher at Nanjing University and Fudan University (China), University of São Paulo (Brazil), International University of Andaluzia and University of La Laguna (Spain), University of Salford and University of Sussex (United Kingdom), State University Península Santa Elena and Escuela Politécnica del Litoral (Ecuador), Florida State University (USA), University Agostinho Neto (Angola), among others. He is grant reviewer for several international agencies (European Union, Japan, Belgium, Canada, Brazil, United Kingdom, Netherlands). His research activity is centred on sustainability assessment and management, including impact assessment, circular economy, public sector, and stakeholder engagement. He is also Executive Editor of the 'Journal of Cleaner Production', Editor-in-Chief of the journal 'Cleaner Production Letters', and member of the Editorial Board of several leading journals, e.g. Sustainable Development, Business Strategy and Development. He was member of the Board of the International Sustainable Development Research Society (ISDRS), member of the Accreditation Council of the Portuguese Order of Engineers and President of the Portuguese Environmental Engineering Association.

editors.affiliation: Aristotle University of Thessaloniki, Thessaloniki, Greece
editors.name: Panos Seferlis
editors.biography: Panos is an Associate Professor and Head of the School of Mechanical Engineering at Aristotle University of Thessaloniki. Holder of a Ph.D. degree in Chemical Engineering from McMaster University, Canada (1995), he has worked as a simulation analysts with Honeywell Hi-Spec Solutions in Canada, and held researcher positions at Delft University of Technology and the Chemical Process Engineering and Energy Resources Institute (CPERI) of Centre for Research and Technology – Hellas.<br>His research interests involve the design, optimization and control for sustainable process systems with emphasis in highly efficient energy conversion and CO2 capture systems. Authored more than 100 articles in peer reviewed international journals and chapters in edited books. Editor of two collective volumes and three journal special issues. He has been involved in a number of research projects as consortium coordinator and principal investigator funded by the European Commission and other National and International funding agencies. He has served as member (since 2006) and Vice President (since 2013) of the scientific committee for the conference series PRES – Conference on Process Integration, Modelling, and Optimisation for Energy Saving and Emission Reduction.</br>

editors.affiliation: Peking University, Beijing, China
editors.name: Xin Tong
editors.biography: Dr Tong Xin received her PHD in College of Urban and Environmental Science of Peking University, and is now working there as an associate professor on the field of industrial ecology. She worked as a visiting scholar in Yale Center of Industrial Ecology in US in 2004 and Lund International Institution of Industrial Environmental Economics (IIIEE) in Sweden in 2014. With the support of China National Science Foundation, she has been working on the Extended Producer Responsibility in e-waste management in China for years, especially focusing on the interactions between the global environmental governance and the technological change in developing countries.

editors.affiliation: The University of Adelaide School of Architecture and Built Environment, Adelaide, Australia
editors.name: Jian Zuo
editors.biography: Dr. Jian Zuo is a Professor in Sustainable Construction at the School of Architecture and Built Environment, The University of Adelaide. His main research interests are related to sustainable built environment via both technical (e.g. smart technologies) and managerial (e.g. policy intervention and behavioural change) means. In particular, he has undertaken extensive research in construction and demolition waste recycling and management. As the lead researcher, he has involved in a series of competitive grants in Australia such as Discovery Projects and Linkage Projects funded by the Australian Research Council as well as many other national key projects. He has long been engaged in the study of ecological towns, green buildings and sustainable development of the construction industry. Published more than 100 papers in top journals, including more than 80 journal papers indexed by SCI and SSCI, Google Scholar indexed more than 20,000, and the H-index is 76.

editors.affiliation: Tsinghua University School of Environment, Beijing, China
editors.name: Chunyan Wang
editors.biography: Chunyan Wang is currently a postdoc researcher at School of Environment, Tsinghua University. She obtained Ph.D. degree in environmental engineering from Tsinghua University. Her research interests include water-energy nexus, urban sustainability, industrial ecology, and material flow analysis. She published several articles in the mainstream peer-reviewed journals in environmental engineering and management, including Environmental Science & Technology, Applied Energy, Journal of Cleaner Production, Energy Policy, Resources, Conservation & Recycling, and Science of the Total Environment. Her work is highly recognized in the academic area, and one of her publications is highly-cited paper. Her current research evolves two folds: (1) material flow analysis at plants (micro-), regional (meso-), and global (macro-) levels; (2) water-energy nexus, focusing especially on the industry sectors (e.g., steel, coal power, and electricity transmission industry) and urban water system.

editors.affiliation: The University of Tennessee System, Knoxville, Tennessee, United States of America
editors.name: Don Huisingh
editors.biography: <p>Dr Huisingh was born in Spokane, Washington, on March 13, 1937. He grew up in Washington, North Dakota and Minnesota. He was awarded his BS from the University of Minnesota in 1961 in Science Specialization, Economics and Horticulture and his PhD from the University of Wisconsin in 1965 in Biochemistry and Plant Pathology. He taught and did research at North Carolina State University in Raleigh North Carolina for 23 years and then moved to Europe where he has taught at Erasmus University in The Netherlands and in Lund University, in Lund, Sweden, since 1987. He has been guest lecturer in more than 60 other universities and has worked on helping to implement Cleaner Production in more than 300 companies and organizations. Presently he teaches part-time at the following institutions: the University of TN in Knoxville, TN, Lund University in Sweden, Erasmus University in The Netherlands and at the Central European University in Budapest, Hungary. He has published more than 350 articles, books, videos and simulations. He is the Founder and Editor-in-Chief of Elsevier's Journal of Cleaner Production that is now being published for the 20th year. He is skilled in interdisciplinary education and holistic approaches to defining and solving society s problems so that effective and equitable approaches can be made toward s Sustainable Societies.</p>

editors.affiliation: Indian Institute of Technology Bombay, Department of Energy Science and Engineering, Mumbai, India
editors.name: Santanu Bandyopadhyay
editors.biography: Santanu Bandyopadhyay is currently Praj Industries Chair Professor, Department of Energy Science and Engineering, at the Indian Institute of Technology Bombay (IIT Bombay). Since 1994, Prof. Bandyopadhyay has been associated with and contributed towards various developmental, industrial, and research activities involving different structured approaches to process synthesis, energy integration and conservation as well as renewable energy systems design. He is a fellow of the Indian National Association of Engineering (INAE).\n <a href="https://www.ese.iitb.ac.in/~santanu/">Editor's Personal Website</a>

editors.affiliation: Polytechnic of Milan, Department of Energy, Milano, Italy

He obtained a M.S. degree, in energy engineering, and a Ph.D, in Energy and Nuclear Science and Technology, at Politecnico di Milano. After post-doctoral activities at Politecnico di Milano, he moved in the innovation-center of a company where he studied, experimentally and numerically, innovative refrigeration systems. From July 2017, he was a Researcher at RSE, a publicly-controlled research center focused on national strategic projects. From February 2021 he was an Assistant Professor at Politecnico di Milano and, since June 2022, he has become a Tenure-Track Assistant Professor. In April 2018, he obtained the Associate Professor Qualification (09/02 – Technical Physics and Nuclear Engineering). He is author of more than 130 publications among international journals, book chapters and conference proceedings. He is associate/subject editor for Applied Thermal Engineering, Journal of Cleaner Production, Renewable Energy, Chemical Engineering Science, Chemical Engineering Research and Design and he is in the editorial board of other journals His main research areas concern (i) multi-scale experimental and numerical investigations of multiphase flows, (ii) multi-scale experimental and numerical investigation of renewable energy-based technologies to decarbonize the residential sector, (iii) multi-scale modeling of the residential sector.\n <a href="https://www4.ceda.polimi.it/manifesti/manifesti/controller/ricerche/RicercaPerDocentiPublic.do?EVN_PRODOTTI=evento&n_docente=besagni&k_doc=289818&lang=EN&aa=2020&tab_ricerca=1">Editor's Personal Website</a>

He had also worked at the World Bank, Harvard University, and Chinese Academy of Sciences before joining Nanjing University in 2002. He has published over 300 papers in international peer-reviewed and Chinese journals, including PNAS, ES&T, Global Environmental Change, Energy Policy, Ecological Economics, and Journal of Cleaner Production. He holds various senior positions in R&D programs in China. In addition, he actively participated in formulating over ten environmental policies in China.</p>

Dr. Miguel Brandao is Associate Professor in Industrial Ecology and Life Cycle Assessment at KTH, Stockholm. Over the last seventeen years, he has taught and researched at a number of organisations around the world.

He works with the use of hard systems approaches that can robustly support decisions towards sustainable development. His research has focused on the integrated assessment of bio-based systems, with emphasis on their impacts on climate change, resource depletion, ecosystem services and biodiversity.

Interests: Circular Economy, Environmental Economics, Ecological Economics, Agroecology, Land Use, Sustainable Production and Consumption, Globalisation, Poverty alleviation, Food Security, Bioenergy, Food.

He is an editor in the Journal of Industrial Ecology, the International Journal of Life Cycle Assessment, and Sustainability.

In 2012, he received the SETAC Europe Young Scientist LCA Award.
 <a href="https://www.kth.se/profile/miguelb">Editor's Personal Website</a>

Her research is generally highly interdisciplinary in a wide range of engineering and science areas applied to renewable energy. In recent years, their scientific research activities have focused on the definition of multidisciplinary frameworks to support the retrofit of existing buildings to make cities more efficient, intelligent, resilient and generally sustainable.

She is also a lecturer at the Faculty of Management under EduLab4Future co-funded by the Eramus plus programme of the EU. From 2018, he has worked for School of Logistics Engineering, Wuhan University of Technology, as the school head.<br>Professor Li’s primary research areas include Sustainable Manufacturing, Intelligent Manufacturing, and recently Human-Robot Collaboration. In the research areas, he has carried out various research projects, mainly sponsored by European Commission, Innovate UK, A&ast;Star of Singapore, and various industries (e.g., Airbus, Rolls-Royce, Sandvik, Jaguar Land Rover). <br>Professor Li’s research publications include four books (Monograph and Edited books published by World Scientific Publisher or Springer), and over 150 research papers in peer-reviewed international journals and conferences. Dudley Award of the prestigious International Journal of Production Research, the Best Paper Awards of the CIRP-sponsored International Conference of Digital Enterprise Technology (UK), International Conference of Systematics, Cybernetics and Informatics (USA), IEEE International Conference of CSCWD (Portugal), etc.<br><br><br><br /></br></br></br></br></br>

editors.name: Gjalt Huppes
editors.biography: <p>Huppes is political scientist and economist by education. He was long term Head of Department Industrial Ecology at CML, Leiden University, till his retirement in 2011. He now is Senior Researcher at CML, the Institute for Environmental Sciences. Since the Eighties of last century, he was actively involved in the development of Life Cycle Analysis (LCA), Material Flow Analysis (MFA) and somewhat later Environmentally Extended Input-Output Analysis (EEIOA). Linking micro-level LCA to macro-level EEIOA, as a hybrid analysis, is one more off-shoot. In 2011 he received the biannual Society Prize of ISIE, the International Society for Industrial Ecology, for his life time contributions.</p>\n\n<p>His PhD study was titled Macro-environmental policy: Principles and Design. Since his retirement his work shifted back to political science: how to link industrial ecology analysis to policy, both reckoning with public policies in IE-analysis and supporting policy design. Fossil energy flows are the main non-circular flows in society now, by mass and by value. His last book is Strategic Designs for Climate Policy Instrumentation: Governance at the Crossroads (Routledge 2019). His current research interest is how the approach as developed for climate policy instrumentation can be expanded, to more broadly cover the material functioning of society. </p>

He has been awarded as ‘Global Highly Cited Scientist’ by Clarivate Analytics, and invited as a ‘Coordinating Lead Author’ in IPCC Sixth Annual Report Workgroup III Chapter 6. Prof. Wei has been awarded by the Prize of Science and Technology for Young Scholars (2001), National Natural Science Fund for Distinguished Young Scholars (2004), and honor of National Excellent Postdoctoral (2005), Hundred Talents Program of the Chinese Academy of Sciences (2005), Chair Professor of Changjiang Scholar program of the Ministry of Education of China(2008), Honor of Excellent Researcher of China Awarded by China Association for Science and Technology(2012), Honor of Excellent Teacher of Beijing Municipality(2013) National High Level Talents Special Support Plan(2017).He also served as the editorial member of several journals.<br><br /></br></br></br></br></br></br></br>

editors.biography: Zuxin Xu presently is the professor for environmental engineering in the College of Environmental Science and Engineering at Tongji University. After received Ph.D degree from Hohai University in 1988, she has been dedicated to river water pollution control and treatment for 30 years, especially in the rehabilitation of seriously polluted urban rivers. In 2019, she was elected as academician of Chinese Academy of Engineering.<br>Prof. Xu took the lead in systematically studying the technical problems for black and odorous water treatment. Following the philosophy of imitating nature, she presented the technical system of synchronizing urban drainage overflow control with river water pollution control, harmonizing water system flowing with hydraulic structurers control, and coupling water quality improvement with water ecological restoration. She put forward the technical schemes of intercepting water pollution sources in conformity with river network flowing, eliminating river’s dry-weather blackness and stench by tidal water energy and controlling river’s wet-weather blackness and stench through abating sewer overflow pollution, which was proved to be very efficient for water quality amelioration of seriously polluted rivers. As<br>the chief scientist for Shanghai’s Suzhou Creek rehabilitation, she made great contribution to getting rid of Suzhou Creek’s blackness and foul stench that had been existed for over 70 years in the history of Shanghai. Suzhou Creek rehabilitation was awarded the Global Energy Prize in 2004 (first prize in the water resources group), which has become the typical case to demonstrate water quality restoration of seriously polluted urban rivers worldwide. As the first accomplisher, she was awarded for China’s National Science and Technology Promotion Prize for two times (2003, 2014), and Shanghai Science and Technology Promotion Prize for seven times including 3 first-grade prizes and 4 second-grade prizes. She has published over 300 papers, 5 books, and has been issued over 30 patents. She was invited to compile special report on urban water pollution control by UN Habitat, which was released during the Fourth session of the UN Environment Assembly.</br></br>

editors.biography: Dr Ivan Bozhikin holds a Ph.D. in Economics from the Vrije Universiteit Brussel (VUB) and a Ph.D. in Political Economy (Microeconomics and Macroeconomics) from the University of National and World Economy (UNWE). He was a Research Fellow at the VUB for two years. Dr. Bozhikin is a reviewer for the Journal of Cleaner Production (IF 11.072) (from May 2016 up to present) and Economic Alternatives Journal (December 2016 up to present). He is also an editorial board member of the Journal of Cleaner Production since 2018. Dr. Bozhikin was a reviewer for the 77th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management (The USA) and 2nd International Conference on New Business Models (Austria). He has been invited as a reviewer in several journals, e.g., Environmental Science & Policy; Journal of Small Business Management; Humanities & Social Sciences Communications. Dr. Bozhikin holds a Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, a Bachelor’s degree in Macroeconomics, a Master’s degree in Business and Finance (Nottingham Trent University, The United Kingdom), and a Master’s degree in Macroeconomics. He has several publications in Bulgarian and international journals. His paper has been published in the Waste Management Journal (IF. 5.448). This paper was also included in a list of articles published in 2017 from Waste Management that have had the most social media attention with their PlumX Metrics. The article entitled “The role of government and key non-state actors in social entrepreneurship: A systematic literature review” has been published in the Journal of Cleaner Production with an impact factor 11.072. Dr. Bozhikin has also participated in several international conferences and seminars, e.g., the 77th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, 26th International Sustainable Development Research Society Conference, and Global Cleaner Production & Sustainable Consumption Conference. Union of Economist in Bulgaria awarded him with second prize at the 10th jubilee competition “Young Economist 2014” (in Category “Ph.D. students and young scientists”). Based on the Expert Committee report and Apex Committee recommendations, Dr. Ivan Atanasov Bozhikin has been selected as Award Winner in Humanities and Social Sciences Discipline, Category: Young Researcher in Economics. The Award was received at the 8th Annual Science and Technology Meet – ASTM 2022, held on 2 July 2022 at Green Park Chennai, India. Moreover, he won the CERGE-EI Teaching Fellows' Career Integration Fellowship. Dr. Bozhikin was also invited as a guest editor of a special issue entitled “Social entrepreneurship, creative territories, and responsible consumption” at Cleaner and Responsible Consumption – the companion journal of the Cleaner brand. Besides, he has written the textbook “Economic policy” in 2022.

editors.biography: Dr.Hesam Kamyab is a Lecturer and Researcher at the Malaysia-Japan International Institute of Technology, Universiti Teknologi Malaysia (MJIIT-UTM) since 2021. Dr. Kamyab was Visiting Researcher Scholar at UTM in 2020. He completed Postdoctoral Research Fellow for three years at the Department of Engineering at UTM in 2017. Also, he was appointed as a visiting researcher at the University of Illinois Chicago (UIC) in 2016. He obtained a Master of Bioscience and Bioengineering (Biotechnology) at UTM. He earned PhD in Civil Engineering in the field of Environmental Engineering at UTM. He received the Young Water Professional Awards by International Water Association (IWA-YWP) in 2014 in Taipei, Taiwan. He is notably known for his active involvement in the International Water Association (IWA) and International Water Association-Young Water Professional IWA-YWP. Dr. Kamyab’s research area has particularly focused on various techniques related to the upstream process comprising isolation, identification, and cultivation of microalgae with agro-wastewater under ponding system and characterization of the microalgae. His research is not limited to considered areas. He remains an active researcher and works on organic waste (composting) management to promote the adoption of greener technologies. More recently, he has developed his research area in the field of energy, bioenergy, biomass, nanotechnology, waste, landfill, and leachate. He has published several papers in reputed journals and has been serving as an active reviewer and editorial board member of repute.

editors.name: Stephen Northey, PhD
editors.biography: <p>Dr Stephen Northey is a Research Fellow at the Department of Civil Engineering, Monash University, Australia, where he is focused on understanding the complex interactions between the mining and metal production industries and long-term sustainable development outcomes. Dr Northey has worked in a range of roles within Monash University and previously CSIRO, where he has assessed scenarios for the global supply and demand of mineral products, evaluated greenhouse gas emissions, water and energy consumption throughout the mining industry, and also has conducted techno-economic and life cycle assessment studies of technologies being developed for mining, mineral processing and metal production. Currently he is particularly interested in understanding how primary supply chains will evolve into the future and also the development of the fundamental datasets required to track industry environmental performance overtime.</p>

editors.biography: Fariborz HAGHIGHAT, Ph.D., P.Eng, FASHRAE, FISIAQ<br>Dr. Fariborz Haghighat is a professor at the Department of Building, Civil and Environmental Engineering – Concordia University, Canada. He earned his B.Eng in Chemical Engineering from Arya-Mehr University of Technology-Iran in 1975, M.A.Sc in Mechanical Engineering from the University of Arizona-USA in 1978, and PhD in Systems Design Engineering from the University of Waterloo-Canada in 1985. He joined Concordia University in 1986 after conducting his post-doctoral research at the Institute for Research Construction, the National Research Council of Canada. Dr. Haghighat’s research aims to achieve sustainability in the built environment. His current research focuses on the fundamental of heat and mass transport in the built environment, and on its applications in the design and analysis of energy-efficient, healthy/immune, and sustainable buildings/communities.<br>﻿<br>Dr. Haghighat is the co-founder of the International Conference on Indoor Air Quality, Ventilation and Energy Conservation in Buildings (1992), one of the most prominent international conferences in this field. A Fellow of ASHRAE and of the International Society of Indoor Air Quality, and Concordia Research Chair in Energy and Environment; in 2019, Dr. Haghighat was named Distinguished University Research Professor at Concordia University. In 2020, he was awarded as an honorable member of the Society of Heating, Air-Conditioning and Sanitary Engineers of Japan.<br>Dr. Haghighat is the Editor-in-Chief of the International Journal of Sustainable Cities and Society, Co-Editor of the International Journal Energy and Built Environment, and editorial board member for numerous journals. He led two international research projects sponsored by the International Energy Agency on the topic of Energy Storage, “Applying Energy Storage in Buildings of the Future, ECES Annex 23” and “Integration of Energy storage with energy efficient buildings and districts: Optimization and Automation”, ECES Annex 31.</br></br></br></br>

editors.biography: Nasrin Aghamohammadi is an Environmental Engineer and public health expert, whose areas of expertise revolve around multidimensional aspects of environmental health, urban health and environmental pollution studies. She has an extensive background in pure and applied environmental engineering research associated with air, water, wastewater, solid waste and soil pollutants. She has published more than 58 impactful peer review Journals on waste management, air pollution, UHI, wastewater treatment and health impacts which are of academic significance to the research community. She has well-established collaborations with the governmental, private and international agencies such as Department of Environment, the Society of Environmental Engineers, Asia-Pacific Academic Consortium for Public Health and the International Society for Applied Life Sciences and Technical Committee for Low Carbon Society 2030. Prof. Chen received his PhD degree from the University of Regina, Canada and B.Eng. from the Dalian University of Technology, China. He worked at the University of Regina, the National Research Council Canada (NRC), and Oil & Gas industry before he joined Concordia University in 2004.Prof.Chen research interests include Water Security, Environmental Impact Assessment, Chemical's Fate and Transport in the Environment, Air Pollution, and Environmental Application of Systems Analysis and Information Technology. Prof. Chen has over 200 publications and supervised over 30 graduate students. He organized and co-organized over 10 international conferences on "Science and Technology for Humanity", "Sustainable Development", "Applied Modeling and Simulation", "Water Resources", and "Environmental Information Technology. Prof. Chen served as Editor Chief of Sustainable Civil Engineering and is currently in editorial board of several environmental journals.

editors.name: Joon-Ho Choi, Ph.D., LEED AP, Assoc. AIA
editors.biography: Dr. Joon-Ho Choi is an Associate Professor of Building Science and the Director of the Center for Wellness in the Built Environment in the School of Architecture at the University of Southern California (USC). He is currently the Associate Dean of Research and Creative Work at USC School of Architecture. In conjunction with Design, Engineering, Computer Science, Psychology, and Medicine, his study focuses on Human-Building Integration from the community scale to individual space. His current research is focused on environmental sustainability in relation to healthy buildings and urban environments, as well as indoor environmental quality, resiliency, human health, and work productivity. Dr. Choi is an Associate Editor for the International Journal of Sustainable Cities and Societies and a member of the International Journal of Energies; Editorial Board, as well as a guest editor for numerous journals. He is also the Technical Program Chair and Board Member of the International Association of Indoor Air Quality, Ventilation, and Energy Conservation in Buildings (IAQVEC), as well as a core member of numerous academic/professional organizations; boards and technical committees, such as the American Society of Heating, Refrigerating, and Air-Conditioning Engineers (ASHRAE) and the U.S. Architectural Research Centers Consortium (ARCC). Dr. Choi has led and participated in two international research projects, sponsored by the International Energy Agency, which are Annex 69 ;Strategy and Practice of Adaptive Thermal Comfort in Low Energy Buildings; and Annex 87;Energy and Indoor Environmental Quality Performance of Personalized Environmental Control Systems. He has engaged in several research initiatives sponsored by international, federal, foundational, and industrial organizations/programs as an interdisciplinary scholar and organized multiple national and international research seminars and symposiums in the domain of sustainability with the support of, U.S. National Science Foundation, IAQVEC, ASHRAE, ARCC, and the U.S. Green Building Council.

editors.affiliation: University College Dublin, Dublin, Ireland
editors.name: Mohammad Sameti, PhD
editors.biography:
Dr. Mohammad Sameti is currently a senior researcher in MaREI and an adjunct lecturer in mechanical engineering working on green hydrogen energy, a partnership between UCC, DCU and NUIG as well as 25 industry companies, with the aim of cost-effective decarbonisation through large-scale implementation of hydrogen technologies in Ireland and EU. 

CURRENT ACTIVITIES: Mohammad is involved in several projects namely HyLIGHT, Green Hysland, and International Energy Agency ANNEX 37. He is exploring the optimisation of green hydrogen supply chains in Ireland as well as developing and implementing a hydrogen ecosystem for Mallorca in collaboration with a wide range of industrial and academic partners in Ireland, the UK, Spain, and Netherlands. The model includes short-, medium-, and long-term supply chain scenarios for green hydrogen in Ireland and Mallorca, considering different electricity supplies (onshore/offshore wind, PV, grid), energy end-uses, supply chain sizes, and geographical locations. He also holds the position as an editor in Intelligent Buildings International published in Taylor and Francis. 

BACKGROUND: Mohammad received his PhD in mechanical engineering from Concordia University, Canada. His previous research was focused on optimization and modelling of district energy systems, integration of renewable energies, hybrid energy systems, thermodynamics cycles, and thermo-economic analysis. Those research areas were connected to IEA-ECES Annex 31 “Energy storage with Net Zero Energy Buildings and Districts: Optimization and Automation” and published as a part of it. Mohammad joined University College Dublin (UCD Energy Institute) under Energy Systems Integration Partnership Programme (ESIPP) as a postdoctoral researcher working on diversification of gas end-use and supply. In that project, Mohammad investigated the potential of an integrated energy system considering the need for gas-fuelled power stations. The proposed model explores future scenarios to complement wind and other renewable electricity sources in Ireland while at the same time covering seasonal peak domestic and industrial heating demands. He is also experienced with numerical and experimental control of lift-WEC wave energy convertors at Center for Ocean Energy Research (COER).

Prof. Inkinen holds also a title of Docent (Adjunct Professor) of Regional Studies (UH). His latest projects include Geography and Innovative Competitiveness? His research interests primarily cover the issues of innovation geography, urban technology, maritime studies, and industrial systems. These include the regional and social structuring of innovation systems, technology integration, regional development and logistics of transport. His latest books include Geographies of Disruption (with Tan Yigitcanlar) by Springer (2019), and Smart Cities and Innovative Urban Technologies by Routledge (2021) and Sustainable Mobility and Transport (2022) by MDPI (both edited with Tan Yigitcanlar and Mark Wilson). He is also a current member of the Research Council for Culture and Society of the Academy of Finland. Inkinen was an Editor-In-Chief (2010-2013) of a peer-reviewed quarterly national journal Terra, Finnish Geographical Journal.\n <a href="https://www.utu.fi/en/people/tommi-inkinen">Editor's Personal Website</a>

editors.biography: Becky P.Y. Loo is Professor and the first female Head of the Department of Geography (2017-2020) since its establishment in 1931 at the University of Hong Kong (HKU). She specialises in using innovative spatial analysis, surveys and statistical methods in analysing pertinent issues related to smart cities, sustainability, regional transport infrastructure and development, transit-oriented development, walkable communities, and road safety. In relation, she is the Director of the Institute of Transport Studies, and the Founding Co-Director of the Joint Laboratory on Future Cities. Becky is also a Fellow of the Academy of Social Sciences, UK (FAcSS), and an Honorary Professor in the Civil, Environmental & Geomatic Engineering Department at UCL. With her people-oriented and place-based research, she spearheaded the journal of Travel Behaviour and Society as the Founding Co-Editor-in-Chief. Her latest research focuses on the creation of better future cities worldwide. In Hong Kong, her current and past public services have included serving on the Common Spatial Data Advisory Committee, the Harbourfront Commission, the Hong Kong Air Transport Licensing Authority, the Lantau Development Advisory Committee, the Road Safety Council, and the Transport Advisory Committee.\n <a href="https://www.bpyloo.net/">Editor's Personal Website</a>

editors.biography:
Joao Martins received the master’s and Ph.D. degrees in electrical engineering from the Instituto Superior Técnico (IST), Technical University of Lisbon, Lisbon, Portugal, in 1996 and 2003, respectively. 
He is currently an Associate Professor with Habilitation at NOVA School of Science and Technology, Universidade NOVA de Lisboa (Portugal). He is the Co-Author of more than 90 scientific articles published in refereed journals and books and more than 190 articles in refereed conference proceedings. His research interests include energy efficiency, alternative energies and power quality, intelligent and energy efficient buildings, heritage buildings, energy awareness, and smart grid renewables integration. 
Dr. Martins is an active member in various program committees of scientific conferences, he is the current Chair of the IEEE-IES Technical Committee on Smart Grids, serves as an Editorial Member / Associate Editor in several journals (Elsevier Sustainable Cities and Societies, IEEE IES Industrial Electronics Magazine, IET Power Electronics, MDPI Energies), and editor of books with Springer. He was and is involved as a member and/or project coordinator in several national and international research projects. In addition, he is an evaluator of research proposals and projects for several national and European funding agencies. He is an IEEE Senior Member, CIGRE Member, Effective Member of Engineers Association (Portugal), and Founding Member of the Portuguese Society for Education in Engineering (SPEE).

I am currently Researcher (in Tenure Track) at Sapienza University of Rome, Department of Astronautical, Electrical and Energy Engineering (DIAEE) for the scientific sector in “Energy and Environment”. I graduated in Mechanical Engineering with specialization in Energy at the University of Rome "Sapienza" in 2003. I completed my PhD in "Technical Physics" in 2008 at the same University. I obtained from the "Ministero dell'Università e della Ricerca" the "National Scientific Qualification for Associate Professor" for the Italian Academic Sector 09/C2 (Applied Physics and Nuclear Engineering). In the same year he joined DIAEE as a fixed-term researcher, for the next 3 years and renewed for the next 2). In recent years, I have carried out research into the optimization of energy demand in buildings; cogeneration systems; urban microclimate; thermal comfort in the outdoor environment; energy optimization and reliability of air conditioning and lighting systems; natural ventilation in buildings; desalination using absorption machines; thermal conductivity problems in soils.
I am a member of the Teaching Board of the PhD course in "Energy and Environment" at Sapienza University of Rome since 2017 and co-tutor of two PhD theses. 
I am in the Editorial Board Members of Sustainable Cities and Society (Elsevier); he is in the International Advisory Board of Thermal Science Journal; he is Associate Editor of Journal of Daylighting (SolarLits); he is in the Editorial Board Members of Atmosphere Journal (MDPI), he is Associate Editor of Journal of Renewable Energy and Technology; he is in the Board Members of Journal of Solar Energy Research Updates (Zeal Press). 
In 2019 I was the Proponent of: International Framework Agreement for Cultural and Scientific Collaboration between Sapienza University of Rome (IT) and University of Plymouth (UK) signed by the Rectors; International Framework Agreement for Cultural and Scientific Collaboration between the two Universities: Sapienza University of Rome (IT) and AGH University of Science and Technology (PL) signed by the Rectors.

editors.biography: Dr. Srebric is a Professor of Mechanical Engineering and Director of the Cluster for SustainabilITY in the Built Environment at the University of Maryland (CITY@UMD). She earned a Ph.D. degree from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology in 2000. The focus of Srebric’s research is on multi-scale modeling of built infrastructure to provide reliable assessments of how these systems affect occupant population, energy consumption, and associated CO2 emissions. She teaches and develops new courses on energy and environmental systems in the built environment with more than several thousands of students who took her courses at University of Maryland, Penn State, and Harvard. She presented more than thirty guest lectures at different universities including Stanford, Princeton, MIT, and Columbia. Dr. Srebric is the author and co-author of roughly two hundred publications, including the “Indoor Environment” chapter in the newest edition of the Mechanical Engineers’ Handbook. The International Academy of Indoor Air Sciences recognized her work on indoor air quality with the 2005 Yaglou award. She was an invited speaker at the National Academy of Engineering’s (NAE) 2011 U.S. Frontiers of Engineering Symposium. Dr. Srebric was elected an international member of the Serbian National Academy of Engineering in 2013. In spring 2016, Srebric was an invited participant at workshops organized by the National Academy of Sciences (NAS) and National Academy of Engineering (NAE), both workshops aimed at charting future directions for research.\n <a href="http://www.buildsci.us/">Editor's Personal Website</a>

editors.name: Geun Young Yun, PhD
editors.biography:
Geun Young Yun is a building scientist working in the area of the design, operation, and evaluation of sustainable buildings and neighbourhoods. He is professor of building science at Department of Architectural Engineering of Kyung Hee University (KHU), South Korea. After obtaining BEng and MEng degrees from Chung Ang University, he worked as an environmental consultant for sustainable building design in both South Korea and UK. His PhD work at University of Cambridge is a critical, new component of developing the understanding of the energy and environmental performance of buildings with respect to the role of human agency, obtained from a combined approach to field measurement and statistical simulation. 

He has been leading the Human Behaviour and Energy Laboratory (HuBEL) at Kyung Hee University since 2010. A central aim of HuBEL is contribute to creating sustainable and healthy buildings and neighbourhoods by carrying out innovative research in the area of human behaviour, comfort, artificial intelligence, energy efficiency, energy and environment, urban climate, renewable energy and architectural lighting. 

He has been received prominent awards including the KHU presidential award for academic excellence, the achievement award from the Korean Institute of Architectural Sustainable Environment and Building Systems (KIAEBS), and the award of excellence in leadership of 100 leading core technologies for Korea 2025 from the National Academy of Engineering of Korea (NAEK). He serves as a vice-president of KIAEBS, a director for Korean Green Building Council (KGBC) and a chairman of the architectural environment committee in Architectural Institute of Korea (AIK). He has won 39 research grants in the area of environment and energy in the built environment from government research agencies and industries including Samsung electronics and LG chemicals since 2010.

Her research revolves around paradigm shifts in human-urban-building interactions with intelligent application of disruptive technologies in the future smart cities for sustainability, economic growth, health, and overall quality of life. In addition, she endeavors to advance technology readiness in the architecture, engineering & construction (AEC) industry, and forge a new path of transforming the AEC field with data-driven and human-centered technologies and analytics.\n <a href="https://sites.google.com/view/s2hub">Editor's Personal Website</a>

editors.name: Wonjun Choi, PhD
editors.biography: Wonjun Choi is currently an Assistant Professor at the School of Architecture, Chonnam National University. He is leading the Building Energy Technology Laboratory. His research focuses on issues related to the design and control of building renewable energy systems. In particular, he has been conducting research on probabilistic system design and control based on estimating uncertainties due to the individuality and complexity of buildings and energy systems, and uncontrollable surrounding environments. Specific examples include the development of a renewable energy network system that combines various renewable energy sources, the probabilistic parameter estimation related to the design and control of energy systems, and the development of a data-driven surrogate model for model predictive control of renewable energy systems.\n <a href="https://betlab.oopy.io/">Editor's Personal Website</a>

editors.name: Maria Ferrara, PhD
editors.biography:
Graduated within the multidisciplinary international honour program Alta Scuola Politecnica based in Italy (2014), PhD with honors in Energetics (2019), Maria Ferrara is currently Assistant Professor at the Polytechnic of Turin, where she carries out teaching and research activities in the field of energy and comfort in buildings. 

She has been visiting research collaborator at Princeton University, USA, and participates in several national and international projects, including IEA Annexes focused on the use of simulation, optimization and artificial intelligence for the optimization of energy storage systems for buildings and cities. She is also coordinator of a multidisciplinary project on smart communities and social innovation. Since 2022, she is part of the Directive Board of IBPSA-Italy. 

For her achievements, she has obtained several awards, including the prestigious Ermenegildo Zegna founders’ scholarship and the Siebel Scholar appointment for academic excellence and demonstrated leadership in the field of Energy Science.

editors.biography: Nima Gerami-Seresht is an Assistant Professor of Sustainable and Resilient Infrastructure in the Department of Engineering at Durham University, UK. Dr Gerami-Seresht received his PhD in Construction Engineering and Management from The University of Alberta, Canada (2017). His theoretical research is focused on multi-agent dynamic systems and granular computing techniques, particularly capturing human behaviours in the built environment. Additionally, his applied research directions involve the applications of dynamic systems and artificial intelligence techniques (i.e., fuzzy computation and machine learning) for improving the sustainability and resilience of urban infrastructure.\n <a href="https://www.durham.ac.uk/staff/nima-gerami-seresht/">Editor's Personal Website</a>

Zahra holds a doctorate in Building Engineering from Concordia University. She is also an adjunct professor at Toronto Metropolitan University and member of ASHRAE. Zahra is an international member of CIB Task Group 97 on nature-based solutions for climate resilient buildings and communities. \nHer current research focus on assessing the NbS to mitigate the effects of urban heat islands (UHI) and urban flooding in Canadian cities. To create impacts of these research, Zahra engages with stakeholders, academia, manufactures, municipalities, associations, and Canadian coding committee and Standards Council of Canada (SCC).\n <a href="https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=P8r3h-sAAAAJ&hl=en">Editor's Personal Website</a>

editors.affiliation: Indiana State University, Terre Haute, Indiana, United States of America
editors.name: Mojtaba Parsaee, PhD
editors.biography:
Dr. Mojtaba Parsaee is an assistant professor at the Department of Built Environment at Indiana State University (United States), actively involved in teaching, and interdisciplinary research in architecture, building engineering, and construction He earned his Ph.D. in architecture from Laval University School of Architecture (Canada) where he also served as a research professional, postdoctoral fellow, and lecturer. Dr. Parsaee also worked as a postdoctoral researcher and project manager at the School of Architecture at McGill University (Canada). He completed a Ph.D. fellowship in building engineering at Concordia University (Canada). He holds M.Sc. and B.Sc. degrees in architectural engineering.
Dr. Parsaee specializes in sustainable built environment design and construction. His research focuses on interdisciplinary approaches to develop high-performance ecological buildings and communities, improve healthy indoor and outdoor environmental qualities, promote decarbonization and circular economy in the construction industry, and mitigate urban warming and climate change. He is also interested in applying data intelligence, computational methods, and integrated visualization techniques as effective tools to facilitate design, decision-making, and knowledge transfer processes in architecture, building, construction, and urban systems.
Dr. Parsaee published several peer-reviewed scientific journals and presented his work at numerous local and international conferences and symposiums.
 <a href="https://www.indstate.edu/faculty-staff/mojtaba-parsaee">Editor's Personal Website</a>

editors.affiliation: Arizona State University, Tempe, Arizona, United States of America
editors.name: Dongwoo (Jason) Yeom, PhD
editors.biography: Dongwoo (Jason) Yeom is a researcher and educator with a strong interest in human-building interaction, high-performance building, and sustainable building design. He has conducted multiple experimental research projects on sustainable design, building performance analysis, indoor environment quality (IEQ), and human-building interaction. At ASU, Dr. Yeom is conducting multidisciplinary research projects, investigating the relationship between the indoor environment, human physiological responses, and occupant behavior and productivity, and also exploring the methodology to use human physiological signals as an indoor environment control factor. Based on his works, Dr. Yeom has published multiple papers in prestigious journals, including Building and Environment, Energy and Buildings, and Indoor and Built environment. Dr. Yeom received his Ph.D., MS, and BS from the Department of Architecture at Ajou University in Korea and conducted his postdoctoral research at California State Polytechnic University Pomona (CPP) and the University of Southern California (USC). Before joining ASU, he worked as an assistant professor of Architecture at Lawrence Technological University in Michigan.\n <a href="https://search.asu.edu/profile/3733254">Editor's Personal Website</a>

At present, she is in charge of three national and provincial scientific research projects, including one National Natural Science Foundation Youth Fund, Youth Fund Project of Science and Technology Department of Sichuan Province, and one basic scientific research project of central universities; During the doctoral period, she has presided over two university-level scientific research projects, including the doctoral innovation fund project and the rail transit top-notch talent cultivation project; She was the main researcher of one general project of NSFC, two international cooperation and exchange projects between NSFC and British Cultural Center, and one IEA project of the International Energy Agency (Annex 37). He has published about 300 articles in different fields of energy (renewable, generation, utilization, storage, conversion, management, saving, etc.) and in the areas of heat transfer (macro and micro-scale heat transfer, heat transfer in porous media, thermal and hydrodynamics behavior of micro-channels, etc.). He was awarded the State Appreciation Award (2021). He was elected as a TWAS Fellow (2016). He was awarded the World Academy of Sciences Award (TWAS) in Engineering Sciences (2013), the Khalifa Award for Education in the category of Distinguished University Professor in the Field of Scientific Research (2012), the Khwarizmi International Award (2012), King Abdullah II Award for Innovation (2010), Scopus Award for Distinguished Researchers (2009), the Jordanian Ministry of Higher Education and Scientific Research Award for the Distinguished Researchers in Engineering (2006), the Abed-Alhameed Shoman Award for Arab Scientists (1994), the Jordan University of Science and Technology medal for distinguished scientific and academic achievements three times (1997, 2006, 2015), the Hisham Hijjawi Award (2003), the Ali Mango Award for Distinguished Researcher in Jordan (2012 ), the Khalil Al-Salem - Philadelphia University Award for the best research paper in Renewable Energy (2014) and many others. He worked many times as an expert in evaluating the EU funded projects of Tempus, FP7 and Erasmus Mundus programs. He acted as an Editor of Energy Conversion and Management, Elsevier during the period 2011-2012. He acted as an Editor-in-Chief of International Journal of Applied Engineering Research for 3 years (2005-2008). He is the founder of Energy Conversion and : X (the open access mirror journal of Energy Conversion and Management). Besides, he acted as an Associate Editor and Editorial Board member in many international journals and he is still performing the same role in many others. He has participated in the international committees of large numbers international scientific conferences.

He is vice-president of Croatian Academy of Technical Sciences and president of International Centre for Sustainable Development of Energy, Water and Environment Systems (SDEWES). He is editor of Q1 “Energy Conversion Management” journal, subject editor for Q1 journal “Energy”, a member of editorial board of following journals: Q1 journal “Applied Energy”, Q3 journal “Thermal Science” and since 2013 he is Editor-in-Chief of Journal of Sustainable Development of Energy, Water and Environment Systems ( JSDEWES. He has organised 17 of the series of conferences on Sustainable Development of Energy, Water and Environment Systems and was a member of organising, scientific and programming committees of more than 40 research conferences. Prof. Duic has received awards from University of Zagreb for improvement of international relations achieved under an international scientific project, National Award for significant scientific achievement in 2016 in the field of technical sciences, Great Medal from Faculty of Mechanical Engineering and Naval Architecture, and Medal Atanasije Stojkovic from Society of Thermal Engineers of Serbia. editors.affiliation: Khalifa University, Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates
editors.name: Dr. Valerie Eveloy, PhD
editors.biography: Dr. Valerie Eveloy is a professor in the department of mechanical engineering at Khalifa University (KU), Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates.  She holds a Ph.D. degree in mechanical engineering (Dublin City University, Ireland) and M.Sc. degree in physical engineering (National Institute of Applied Science, France). She has over twenty five years academic and industrial experience in mechanical and energy engineering. Prior to joining Khalifa University, she was with The Petroleum Institute (now part of Khalifa University), the University of Maryland-College Park, and Nokia. Her current research interests include energy system modeling and optimization, energy recovery, hydrogen from renewable power, and sustainable cooling. She has led a number of sponsored research projects in these areas, and currently leads the Sustainable Energy Policy and Techno-Socio-Economics theme of Abu Dhabi Virtual Research Institute (VRI) on Sustainable Energy Production, Storage, and Utilization. She is an editorial board member of several international energy-related journals and has served as a guest editor for journal special issues related to sustainable and renewable energies, power-to-x and decarbonization of energy-intensive industry. She is member of a number of international conference program committees focused on energy technologies and electronics thermal management.

editors.affiliation: American University of Beirut, Beirut, Lebanon
editors.name: Professor Nesreen K. Ghaddar, PhD
editors.biography: Dr. Nesreen Ghaddar is a professor of mechanical engineering and the director of the Munib and Angela Masri Institute of Energy and Natural Resources at the American University of Beirut. She received he bachelor of Engineering from Kuwait University (1980), her master (1982) and PhD (1985) degrees from Massachusetts Institute of Technology, USA. She served as the chairperson of the Mechanical Engineering Department at AUB for six years from 2001-2007. She was Associate Provost from 2008-2015. Dr. Ghaddar conducts research on sustainable air-conditioning with renewable energy integration and means for improving the wellbeing and productivity of peoples in living and working environment at low cost using wearable and modular technologies of personal cooling.  Her line of work encompasses sustainable solutions that combat global warming. She works on personalized ventilation, body cooling methods, thermal comfort, indoor air quality, and building energy performance, hybrid cooling and power systems to meet building needs. She has been instrumental in development of specialized and interdisciplinary educational programs and labs in applied energy, energy studies as well as founding the first online green technologies diploma at AUB. She established another new online postgraduate diploma in building energy systems. Dr. Ghaddar received the Abdul Hameed Shoman Award for Arab Researchers (Green Engineering) for 2013.  In 2014 she was listed by Muslim Science among the top-20 Most Influential Women in Science in the Islamic World described as the Shaper of Energy Future, Kuwait and Lebanon. She is  a fellow of the American Society of Mechanical Engineers, ASHRAE, the Islamic World Academy of Sciences; and the Lebanese Academy of Science.\n <a href="https://www.aub.edu.lb/pages/profile.aspx?memberId=farah">Editor's Personal Website</a>

editors.affiliation: Universiti Sains Malaysia Pusat Pengajian Kejuruteraan Kimia, Pulau Pinang, Malaysia
editors.name: Dr. Keat Teong Lee
editors.biography: Dr. Lee Keat Teong obtained his Ph.D in Chemical Engineering from Universiti Sains Malaysia (USM) in 2004. He is currently a Professor at the School of Chemical Engineering and the Director of Research Creativity & Management Office, Universiti Sains Malaysia. Dr. Lee has co-authored 1 book, 8 book chapters, 28 review papers and more than 100 research papers in peer reviewed international journals. Dr. Lee is currently the Co-Editor for Energy Conversion and Management (Elsevier) and Editorial Board Member for Bioresource Technology (Elsevier) and Energy Science & Engineering (Wiley). Currently he is working on the production of biofuels (biodiesel and bioethanol) from biomass (including macro and microalgae) using various technologies. Apart from that, he also has special interest on the social and sustainability aspects of biofuels.​

editors.affiliation: Hanyang University, Department of Mechanical Engineering, Seongdong-gu, South Korea
editors.name: Professor Kwan-Soo Lee
editors.biography: <p>Kwan-Soo Lee is a Distinguished Professor of Mechanical Engineering at Hanyang University, where he served as Provost and Senior Vice President from 2016 to 2017. Prof. Lee is also the Senior member of the National Academy of Engineering of Korean from 2010 to present. Furthermore, he is the fellow member of the Korean Academy of Science and Technology from 2107 to present. He was awarded Academic Award for Thermal Engineering (KSME 2017), Paiknam Outstanding Faculty Award (Hanyang University 2014), Award for Outstanding Achievement and Contribution in Research (LG Corporation 2006), Award for Achievement in Research (LG electronics 2003), Best Teacher Award (Hanyang University 2003 & 2004), Academic Award (KSME 2002), Award for Achievement in Research (Hanyang University 1999), Award for Achievement in Research (Hanyang University 1998), Paiknam Academic Award (Hanyang University 1998), Nam-Heon Academic Award (KSME 1997), Academic Award (SAREK 1996), and Award for Excellence in Research Paper (KFSTS 1995). Prof. Lee’s interest focuses on heat transfer and low carbon. The aim of the research is to save energy and reduce carbon dioxide emission by improving energy efficiency. His group is actively researching the optimal design of heat exchangers and electronic cooling.</p>

editors.affiliation: Ontario Tech University, Oshawa, Ontario, Canada
editors.name: Professor Marc Rosen
editors.biography: <p>Marc A. Rosen is a Professor of Mechanical Engineering at the University of Ontario Institute of Technology in Oshawa, Canada, where he served as founding Dean of the Faculty of Engineering and Applied Science from 2002 to 2008. Dr. Rosen was President of the Engineering Institute of Canada from 2008 to 2010, and President of the Canadian Society for Mechanical Engineering from 2002 to 2004. He is a registered Professional Engineer in Ontario, and has served in many professional capacities, e.g., as a member of the Board of Directors of Oshawa Power and Utilities Corporation. He serves on the editorial boards of several technical journals and as an advisory member of several leading international conferences. With over 70 research grants and contracts and 600 technical publications, Dr. Rosen is an active teacher and researcher in thermodynamics, energy technology (including cogeneration, trigeneration, district energy, thermal storage, renewable energy, and hydrogen technologies), sustainable energy and the environmental impact of energy and industrial systems. Much of his research has been carried out for industry. Dr. Rosen has worked for such organizations as Imatra Power Company in Finland, Argonne National Laboratory near Chicago, and the Institute for Hydrogen Systems near Toronto. He was also a professor in the Department of Mechanical, Aerospace and Industrial Engineering at Ryerson University in Toronto, Canada for 16 years. While there, Dr. Rosen served as department Chair and Director of the School of Aerospace Engineering. Dr. Rosen has received numerous awards and honours, including an Award of Excellence in Research and Technology Development from the Ontario Ministry of Environment and Energy, the Engineering Institute of Canada's Smith Medal for achievement in the development of Canada, and the Canadian Society for Mechanical Engineering's Angus Medal for outstanding contributions to the management and practice of mechanical engineering. He received a distinguished scholar award from Ryerson University and a Mid-Career Award from University of Toronto. He is a Fellow of the Engineering Institute of Canada, the Canadian Academy of Engineering, the Canadian Society for Mechanical Engineering, the American Society of Mechanical Engineers and the International Energy Foundation. Dr. Rosen obtained a B.A.Sc. (1981) in Engineering Science, and a M.A.Sc. (1983) and Ph.D. (1987) in Mechanical Engineering, all from the University of Toronto.</p>

editors.biography: Professor Ir. Dr. Nor Aishah Saidina Amin is a Professor of Reaction Engineering, Head of the Chemical Reaction Engineering Group (CREG) at the Faculty of Chemical and Energy Engineering, Universiti Teknologi Malaysia. She graduated with a PhD in Chemical Engineering from Illinois Institute of Technology, Chicago, USA in 1996. Her expertise is in applied catalysis and reaction engineering. She has seven patents granted and have filed 20 patents for her innovations. She has written three books, 6 book chapters and more than 200 WOS-Indexed journal papers. She is a professional engineer and an IChemE fellow (FIChemE). In recognition of her scholarly activities, she is conferred the Fellow of Academy Science and recognized as the Top Research Scientist Malaysia (TRSM) by the Academy of Sciences Malaysia (ASM). She was also the winner of the Malaysia Research Star Award under the outstanding research on Global Warming and International Research Collaboration categories, respectively. She is the recipient of the MIT-UTM Sustainability City and Fulbright scholar fellowships. Her other accolades include Gold Medals at various Innovation competitions, Leaders in Innovation Fellowship Award by the Royal Academy of Engineering, UK and Highly Cited Researcher.

editors.name: Assoc. Professor Annamaria Buonomano, PhD
editors.biography: Dr. Annamaria Buonomano is a full time Associate Professor at the Department of Industrial Engineering of the University of Naples Federico II, Italy. She received her PhD in Energetics from the University of Palermo in 2010 and holds a B.Sc. and a M.Sc. degree in Engineering Management (curriculum in Energy Management) summa cum laude in 2004 and 2006 from the University of Naples Federico II. During her postdoctoral studies (2010 to 2014), she awarded several positions  at the Department of Energetics applied Thermo-fluid-dynamics and Environmental Control of University of Naples Federico II to develop building energy performance simulation models and innovative building-plant solutions for the energy efficiency of buildings, also based on integrated construction techniques and renewable energy technologies. She was also visiting scholar at the Energy Performance of Buildings Group of the Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory (Berkeley, USA) in 2009 and researcher at the Ben Gurion National Solar Energy Center of the Jacob Blaustein Institutes for Desert Research of University of Ben Gurion (Sde Boqer, Israel) in 2011, with the aim at conducting studies on hybrid ventilation and concentrating photovoltaic thermal systems, respectively. From 2015 she has been visiting scientist at Concordia University (Montreal, Canada), where she was appointed as Affiliate Assistant Professor from 2017 to 2020 in the Department of Building, Civil and Environmental Engineering for developing a joint research on modeling and design of net zero energy buildings and integration of passive solar thermal systems in buildings. She has received a total of 417 k€ of research grant (by the Italian Ministry of Education, University and Research, MIUR) and public and private funding (by Ministry of Economic Development and Fincantieri) to develop comprehensive studies and simulation models for the energy efficiency of buildings and ships, the thermal comfort and wellbeing of occupants and travelers.\n\nHer current research interests focus primarily on energy efficiency and renewable technologies applied to buildings and transportation systems with a particular focus on the development of performance simulation models and investigation of innovative building-plant solutions based on integrated construction techniques, innovative HVAC systems and novel renewable energy technologies including solar heating and cooling systems, concentrating photovoltaic solar thermal systems, polygeneration. She is also involved in collaborative research activities relative to the design of net zero energy buildings and communities through the integration of passive solar thermal systems in buildings and the use of storages and electric vehicles to add flexibility to buildings (vehicle-to-grid, vehicle-to-building and related advancements as B2V2B and V2B2). On these topics, she supervised and co-supervised more than 110 M.Sc., Ph.D. and postdoctoral students over the last years.

She also holds degrees in Chemical Engineering (1992) and in Industrial Engineering (1993), as well as an MBA (1995) from the same University.<br>Dr Cabeza joined the University of Lleida in 1999 where she created the research group GREA and started her research on thermal energy storage (TES). Her interests include the different TES technologies (sensible, latent and thermochemical), applications (buildings, industry, refrigeration, CSP, etc.), and social aspects.<br>Dr Cabeza is very active in the storage implementing agreement (ECES IA) of the International Energy Agency. She also acts as subject editor of the journals Renewable Energy, and Solar Energy.</br></br>

editors.affiliation: Nanyang Technological University, Singapore, Singapore
editors.name: Professor Siew Hwa Chan
editors.biography: <p>Dr. Chan joined NTU as a Lecturer in 1991 after obtaining his PhD and subsequently working as a postdoctoral researcher at Imperial College London. He is now a Professor in the School of Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering and a Co-Director of Energy Research Institute at NTU (ERI@N), where he was one of the founders of the Institute. Prof. Chan is a Non-Executive Director of Maz Energy Pte Ltd, where he provides technical advices to the Board since 2004. He is also the Technical Advisor General to Wuhan KOLEAL, a company in New Energy Materials. Prof. Chan is a member of Management Board of Energy Studies Institute, Singapore as well as a member of Advisory Board of Horizon Fuel Cell Technologies. Dr. Chan’s research is inclined to Energy covering Heat Engines, Fuel Cells and Hydrogen Technologies. He is the Organizer and Program Chair of the 1st World Hydrogen Technologies Convention (WHTC), Singapore. From 2006 to 2008, he held a joint appointment with A&ast;Star as Director of SERC Fuel Cell Programme. Under this appointment, he led a team of more than 100 researchers from 4 A&ast;Star research institutes working with industries. His research has gained him a number of international recognitions, which include George-Stephenson Award from the Institution of Mechanical Engineers, UK, in 2000, Scientific Achievement Award from International Association of Hydrogen Energy, USA in 2007, “World’s Most Influential Scientific Minds” award from Thomson Reuters in 2014, and Nanyang Award (Research Excellence) in recognition of outstanding contribution in scientific knowledge on a global scale through novel research breakthrough in 2015. He is the editorial board member of “<em>Fuel Cells – from fundamentals to systems” </em>and also <em>“Journal of Power Technologies”</em>. Dr. Chan has published 230 refereed journal papers with a total citation of >8000 and h-index of 50.</p>

editors.affiliation: University of Genoa, Genova, Italy
editors.name: Professor Paola Costamagna, PhD
editors.biography:
I graduated in Chemical Engineering 'cum laude' at the University of Genoa (Italy) in December 1992. In July 1997, I earned a Ph.D. in Chemical Engineering from the Polytechnical School of Turin (Italy). Afterward, I continued my research activity at the University of Genoa, and at the Department of Chemistry of Princeton University, NJ (USA), where, in 1999, I spent the whole year as a research associate. From 2001 to 2005, I was a researcher in the field, ING-IND/24, Principles of Chemical Engineering, at the University of Genoa. Since February 1, 2005, I have been an associate professor in the field ING-IND/25, Chemical Plants, at the same University, where I currently teach the courses 'Chemical Engineering Computing' and 'Separation Columns'.
My research focuses on chemical and electrochemical reactors, with attention to the optimization of all those aspects which could improve efficiency and environmental compatibility. More in detail, my studies focus on fuel cells of various types, and steam methane reforming reactors. I have developed both experimental and theoretical activities, at all levels of detail, from the microscopic scale, up to the reactor and whole plant scale. 
I have taken part in several research projects, sponsored by various Italian and international organizations (EU, MURST, CNR, DOE, British Council). I was responsible for a research contract between the University of Genoa and Rolls-Royce Fuel Cell Systems (UK), from 2002 to 2009, and during that period my Chair at the University of Genoa was financed by Rolls-Royce Fuel Cell Systems (UK). Recently (2019-2022), I was responsible for two projects sponsored by Regione Liguria. One was focused on the development of a FEM simulation tool for a steam methane reforming reactor operating at the refinery IPLOM (Busalla, GE, Italy). The second was focused on the development of membrane filtration plants.
I am the author of over 130 papers in international journals, conference proceedings, and chapters of edited books. Bibliometric indicators: H-index 27, total citations 5379 (Scopus, August 2022). 

Top Scientist
The international journal PLOS Biology recently published a ranking of the best scientists in the world. Based on bibliometric parameters, the authors of the work evaluated all researchers who have at least 5 papers recorded by the Scopus database: about 6,900,000 scientists worldwide. This allowed the names of the first 100,000 scientists to be sorted and published, corresponding to 1.5% of those evaluated. I am on the list, at position 82602. For more details: J.P.A. Ioannidis et al. (2019), A standardized citation metrics author database annotated for scientific field. PLoS Biol, 17(8) e3000384. https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pbio.3000384.

Research Interests
My research is focused on three main topics.
The first topic is electrochemical reactors (fuel cells and electrolyzers), with attention to the optimization of all those aspects which could improve the energy efficiency and the environmental compatibility of the reactor and eventually of the whole plant. The studies have been concentrated on solid oxide and proton exchange membrane cells (SOCs and PEMCs respectively). I developed both experimental and theoretical activities, and all the levels of detail have been analyzed, from a microscopic scale (electrolyte and electrodes), up to the single cell and stack scale and then to the whole plant scale. 
The second topic is steam methane reforming (SMR) reactors, through an innovative multiscale modeling approach, addressing the catalyst, tube, and furnace levels simultaneously. 
The third topic is water treatment and reverse osmosis. 

Editorial Activity
I have been serving as a reviewer for several international journals, including the Journal of Applied Electrochemistry, Journal of Power Sources, Journal of Fluids Engineering, Journal of Engineering for Gas Turbines and Power, Electrochimica Acta, Industrial and Engineering Chemistry Research, Journal of Membrane Science, Chemical Engineering Science, Journal of the Electrochemical Society. I have been recognized as Outstanding Reviewer by the Elsevier Journals: Journal of Cleaner Production, Journal of Power Sources, Electrochimica Acta, International Journal of Hydrogen Energy. 
Since 2003, I have been a member of the Editorial Board (International Advisory Board) of the Journal of Power Sources (Elsevier, IF2019: 8.247). Since 2017, I have been a member of the Editorial Board (Editorial Advisory Board) of Energy Conversion and Management (Elsevier, IF2019: 8.208). Since February 2020, I have been a member of the editorial board of ‘Energies’, section ‘Hydrogen Energy’ (MDPI, IF2019:2.702).
I was Guest Editor of a Special Issue of Energies (MDPI) titled ‘Reacting Transport Phenomena in Electrochemical Cells’, 2015/2016. Furthermore, I was Guest Editor of a Special Issue of Catalysts (MDPI) titled ‘Solid Oxide Fuel Cells – The Low Temperature Challenge’, 2018/19.
I was a member of the scientific committee of several international conferences (EU SOFC & SOE Forum, Luzern, CH, editions 2016, 2018, 2020 and 2022).

Thesis Direction
Since 2003, I have supervised 22 BSc Theses, 28 MSc Theses, and 7 Ph.D. Theses at the University of Genoa, Italy.

editors.name: Professor Tim Fisher
editors.biography: Timothy S. Fisher was born in Aurora, IL. He received Ph.D. and B.S. degrees in Mechanical Engineering from Cornell University in 1998 and 1991, respectively, and joined the Purdue's School of Mechanical Engineering and Birck Nanotechnology Center in 2002 after several years at Vanderbilt University. In 2008 he was a Visiting Professor in the Chemistry and Physics of Materials Unit of the Jawaharlal Nehru Centre for Advanced Scientific Research (JNCASR, Bangalore, India), and he now holds the position of Adjunct Professor in the International Centre for Materials Science at JNCASR and co-directs the JNCASR-Purdue Joint Networked Centre on Nanomaterials for Energy. From 2009 to 2011, he served as a Research Scientist at the Air Force Research Laboratory’s newly formed Thermal Sciences and Materials Branch of the Materials and Manufacturing Directorate. In 2013 he became the James G. Dwyer Professor in Mechanical Engineering at Purdue. Prior to his graduate studies, he was employed from 1991 to 1993 as a design engineer in Motorola's Automotive and Industrial Electronics Group. His research has included efforts in simulation and measurement of nanoscale heat transfer, coupled electro-thermal effects in semiconductor and electron emission devices, nanoscale direct energy conversion, molecular electronics, microfluidic devices, biosensing, hydrogen storage, and related computational methods ranging from atomistic to continuum scales. He has advised or co-advised the completion of 17 PhD degrees, 28 MS degrees, and 12 postdoctoral/visiting research experiences during his career to date. He has published the results of this work widely in more than 150 archival journal articles, 5 book chapters, and over 200 conference papers. Professor Fisher's work has been recognized with the 2013 Purdue College of Engineering Mentoring Award, 2012 ASME McDonald Mentoring Award, Fellow of the ASME (2011), a University Faculty Scholar Award (2009-2014, Purdue), the Discovery in Mechanical Engineering Award (2007, Purdue), invited participation at the Frontiers of Engineering Symposium (2007, National Academy of Engineering), a CAREER award (2000-2005, National Science Foundation) a 3M Nontenured Faculty Award (1999), and several Best Paper and Best Poster awards, including the Best Paper Awards at the 2011 and 2009 ASME InterPACK Conferences. He has been a member of ASME since 1993 and has chaired numerous sessions at ASME conferences through active participation in the K6 (energy) and K16 (electronics) technical committees of the Heat Transfer Division. More recently, he has served in conference leadership positions, including as Technical Committee Co-Chair for the 2010 AIAA/ASME Joint Thermophysics and Heat Transfer Conference and for the 2007 ASME Energy Nanotechnology International Conference (Sept. 2007). In Fall 2010, he became Chair of the ASME Heat Transfer Division’s K6 Technical Committee on Heat Transfer in Energy Systems.

He is also Director of the National Science Foundation Cooling Technologies Research Center.
